ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would recommend it. It's a great way to get your writing up to parr, and the intimate feel is nice. However, if you are a confident writer, I would recommend a high level class.
Take this if you need the writing credit or just want to take an english class. If you find a section topic that interests you then the reading will be enjoyable and discussions will be great.

If the course is on Performing Ourselves.. Take it! I enjoyed it a lot and it made me look at gender, class, race, social status, and the way we perform them in a whole different way. The course material is difficult to understand sometimes, but Professor Wiet really helps a lot on this (plus, she mentioned she was planning on taking some of the more confusing readings out.. so its likely you won't have a problem on this). If you want to improve your writing, this is the course to take! Just make sure you pick a topic you are interested in.

I would call it a mind-opening look at identity in ourselves and in society. I would definitely recommend it. I found the subject extremely interesting and also believe that everyone should have a sense of all aspects of identity, particularly in evaluating oneself.

Good class to fill a writing credit. Also good for those interested in writing about a certain topic of interest. The many sections of 114 make it easy to find a topic that you are interested in writing about.

I would definitely recommend this course; it was my favorite of all my classes this year. I feel as though Professor Wiet played a big role in my positive experience of the course, so I would especially recommend taking it with her. However, the material was also great and I felt as though I learned a lot so I would still recommend it to a fellow student, even with a different instructor.

English 114 26 has not only made me a stronger, more perceptive writer and reader, but a more self-aware person. Through this course, I received a fantastic introduction to academic writing, and feel highly prepared for future college papers. I was able to learn this, however, by reading some of the most eye-opening papers - papers that allowed me to understand far more about myself and the surrounding world. Performance studies seem to be the perfect gateway into a better understanding of identity and the limitless possibilities of performing and presenting that identity - topics I find very important and relevant to any young person/college student. For these reasons, I would highly recommend this class to other students.
